intro: Dianthera racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Dianthera racemosa produces small, clustered inflorescences, which contribute to its ornamental value in native gardens.
